decision_conditions:
<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
margin-left:0cm;text-align:justify;line-height:normal"><span style="font-size:
12.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-fareast-font-family:&quot;Times New Roman&quot;;
mso-fareast-language:EN-GB">Notwithstanding the first reason for refusal, the
proposed development would i) provide a poor standard of living accommodation for
the upper level flat in terms of external amenity, and ii) in absence of
sectional drawings it cannot be established if both flats comply with the
prescribed internal space standards. As such, the proposal is contrary to Policy
D6 of the London Plan (2021), Policy CS15 of the Waltham Forest Local Plan Core
Strategy (2012), Policy DM7 of the Waltham Forest Local Plan Development
Management Policies (2013), and the Urban Design SPD (2010).<o:p></o:p></span></p>
description: Conversion of existing dwellinghouse (1x6-bed) (Use Class C3) into two self-contained flats (1x1-bed & 1x3bed) (Use Class C3). Associated works to include refuse/recycling storage to front garden area and bicycle parking provision to rear garden area.

constraints_details.result: 47 West End Avenue, Leyton, London, E10 6DY
